snippet: Lawmakers are lining up for a chance to take money from the banks — and do their bidding.
abstract: Editorial notes popularity of House Financial Services Committee among congressmen is due to fact that those who serve on the committee can raise enormous sums of money from banking industry; contends situation cries out for public financing system for Congressional elections; maintains that at a minimum, committee members should disclose when they are voting on an issue that affects donors from whom they have accepted campaign donations.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers are lining up for a chance to take money from the banks — and do their bidding.
